shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 1r-159rb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 1r-118v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 119r-131r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 131v-137v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 138ra-152vc, 159ra-159rb) II) Unidentified text (fols. 153r-158v), incomplete (?)
Additiones 1-3.

originlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

locationlink.xlink:title: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

owners.owner: The name of Wäldä Haymanot (with the names of his children) is mentioned on fols. 40v, 66r, 79v, 118v, 137v, and in Additio 1.

dcomments.dcomment: 18th century (?). Fols. 153-158 (in quire XVI) are of later period.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. shows traces of extensive use. A part of the front is missing. All fols. are damaged by rodents, with minor text loss on fols. 1r, 1v, 159r, 159v. Fols. 153-158 (in quire XVI), of smaller size, were added later.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the left broken and mostly missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
I፩(10/fols. 1r-10v) – ፪II፪(10/fols. 11r-20v) – ፫III(10/fols. 21r-30v) – IV፬(10/fols. 31r-40v) – ፭V፭(10/fols. 41r-50v) – ፮VI፮(10/fols. 51r-60v) – ፯VII፯(10/fols. 61r-70v) – ፰VIII፰(10/fols. 71r-80v) – ፱IX፱(10/fols. 81r-90v) – X(11; s.l.: 7, stub after 4/fols. 91r-101v) – ፲፩XI፲፩(10/fols. 102r-111v) – ፲፪XII፲፪(10/fols. 112r-121v) – ፲፫XIII፲፫(10; s.l.: 3, stub after7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 122r-131v) – [፲፬]XIV[፲፬](10/fols. 132r-141v) – [፲፭]XV(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 142r-150v) – XVI(4+{6}/fols. 151r-160v).
Fols. 153r-158v are an eccentric insertion in quire XVI.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: All data for fol. 6r. The size of fols. is difficult to estimate due to the condition of the Ms.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text I-4, fols. 138ra-159rb: All data for fol. 139r. The size of fols. is difficult to estimate due to the condition of the Ms.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Text II, fol. 153r-158v: All data for fol. 153r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking is visible. Most fols. are unruled, or crudely ruled. Ruling is disregarded by the scribe on fols. 155v, 156r, 156v.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: crude, very poor.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: the letter shapes of the script appears elegant and finely rounded, but the quality of the execution is mediocre to poor. The numeral ፮ looks like compressed numeral ፯. Hand b (fols. 153r-158v, Text II).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra in Texts I-4 and II; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; name, number and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; few lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of Text I-4; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; a few single words in Texts I-4; incipit of the subsections in Text II; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሠ፡/ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 138ra-rc) እ᎓/እስ፡/እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 139rc-140vb) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 141ra-142va) ናዓብ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 143rc-144vb) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fols. 145rb-va) ተፈሥሒ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 146rb-148rb) ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 147va-148ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text II may be several antiphons or short hymns.

additional.det: Written in a recent hand, the same one that wrote the supplications for the owner, with the same name Wäldä Haymanot.
The note is mostly illegible, written in Amharic.

extras.extra: - Supplication for Wäldä Haymanot, the owner of the Ms., and his children have been written in the margin in a more recent hand, possibly the same as Additio 1: 40v, 66r, 79v, 118v, 137v. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 77) is marked on fol. 61v, through a line with alternating black and red letters. - The rubricated titles are partly missing in Text I-3: fols. 132v, 135r, 137r. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. - Several short prayers or blessings, or magic recipes (?) written in the margin: fols. 65v, 112v, 120v, 147v. - On many fols., two psalm lines are accomodated in one written line. For that, the scribe reduced the size of the script and space between the letters: e.g., fols. 7r., 14v, 17r-v, 18v, 19r etc. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 10v, 20v. - Omitted passage of Ps. 87 has been written in the margin (and over erasure in the written area), in smaller script, for which purpose additional lines were ruled: fols. 69v, 70r. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages are added interlineally: e.g., fols. 6v, 7v, 10v, 14v, 16v, 19v, 20r, 27v, 38v, 49r, 66v, 68r, 95r, 103v, 120r. - Erasures marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 23r, 84r. - Erasure of full written lines: e.g., fols. 51v, 74v, 115r, 138r, 148rc.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the inner upper corner on the first and last fol. of the quires: fols. 10v, 11r, 20v, 21r, 40r, 41v, 50v, 51r, 60v, 61r, 70v, 71r, 80v, 81r, 90v, 91r, 101v, 102r, 111v, 112r, 121v, 122r, 131v, 132r, 141r, 141r.

frames.frame: - Fols. 1r, 41r, 80r, 119r: finely elaborate ornamental bands separating groups of 50 Pss., Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat, and Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy; interlaces, anthropomorphic motifs. - Fols. 138r: fine, elaborate coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; anthropomorphic motifs, interlaces, geometrical motifs.
